title: I'm getting really tired of the "better jungler wins" meta
body:
Can junglers at least not have the luxury to spend 2 minutes waiting and trying over and over again for a kill?

I'd also love for matchmaking to give me the aggressive jungler for once, but alas, these days I have a rift herald knocking on my base at min 15 instead.

replies.body: The "better player wins" should be the meta.

no

the better team wins should be the meta.
I think he just meant lane but that's also true.

even lanes ought to be determined by teamplay.
jungel ganks, midlane roams, top lane teleport ganks, the like.

> top lane teleport ganks

Hi, Internet Explorer.
even though its slow it still is a thing that happens.

Hardly at all in lower elo. 
Haven't seen one in months.

I think they died with Malzahar Mid.

what does "Malzahar Mid" mean?

Edit: I just realized this post is 6 months old and someone Necro'd it, now my joke isn't funny.
Yeah because 1 asshole should be able to decide the game. Real good idea.
pardon?

It's much much muccccch easier for 1 person to lose the game for the team being a troll, than it is for 1 good player to carry his team because he's better than the other 9.

It's fine to make it a team focused game, but not so much that 1 person has the ability to ruin the entire game. And every season riot does so more and more.

Still better than the alternative, because between the two the asshole has more power in the single person carrying than he does in the teamplay.

It's a lot easier to feed one guy a whole lot than it is to feed a team.
Yeah giving the power to a troll is a great idea.
but in my stance the troll has less power.
How does a troll have less power?

because in one stance the one player wins, the best player wins right? so the troll only needs to feed one guy to hell.

In my goal, the troll would need to make the entire enemy team better for it to count.

It should be better lane.

Really annoying to have laning phase be made irrelevant, and it's especially bad for lane bullies and majority of top laners

laning phase is relevant, thats the point in the game where you can make your opponent weaker than they otherwise would be.

It should NOT be the deciding factor of a game though. earlygame should set the stage for midgame, not decide the whole game.
You used to be able to do it, but not anymore.

I am not saying that you can't win lane to win game now.

I am saying that you should NEVER be able to win lane to win game.

That's a stupid idea. the game has stages, each stage should be important, for this to matter the first stage should not be the stage that winning happens.

That's just it, it doesn't happen anymore.

You can't win lane to win game, you see this especially if you play a lot of top lane.

> [{quoted}](name=VulDread,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=1fVtK3wr,comment-id=0000000000030000000000000000,timestamp=2017-05-07T04:03:31.520+0000)
>
> That's just it, it doesn't happen anymore.
> 
> You can't win lane to win game, you see this especially if you play a lot of top lane.

As a top lane, mid  lane secondary player, I've never felt more powerless.

Hell...the most success I've had is picking Morgana mid and just ensuring that whoever between the jungler and the ADC is more fed gets CC immunity.

> [{quoted}](name=macromite,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=1fVtK3wr,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-05-06T15:00:04.106+0000)
>
> no
> 
> the better team wins should be the meta.

That is the meta. Too many games I've been the better jungler and lost because instead of pushing the lead as a team, people just run off with the lead I gave them thinking they can 1v5 and eventually throw. Obviously asking them to group and stop suiciding is flaming and toxic, so I'd rather stay quiet and watch them die over and over.

> [{quoted}](name=EpilepticRabbit,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=1fVtK3wr,comment-id=000000000006,timestamp=2018-10-19T15:02:42.256+0000)
>
> That is the meta. Too many games I've been the better jungler and lost because instead of pushing the lead as a team, people just run off with the lead I gave them thinking they can 1v5 and eventually throw. Obviously asking them to group and stop suiciding is flaming and toxic, so I'd rather stay quiet and watch them die over and over.

This is a pretty accurate description of seasons 7 and 8. I've lost so many games because I bet on the wrong laner to be smart enough and group.
Talk about splitting hairs.
These aren't comparable concepts at all.
What?

Better team is better team.

Better player is better player.

If you aren't understanding the difference then I can't help you.

A better team will beat a better team

A better player will beat a better player

A better player will not beat a better team

I don't know why this is so hard for you.

I still think it's the meta. 

An early game meta will always have junglers as the MVPs, because they don't actualy hard carry, just snowball their team to do it for them.
In other words, some asshole made a Lee Sin meta.

This is so god damn true. 
Nowadays junglers literally win games alone. 

I feel like I'm totally worthless compared to junglers. Sometimes I play games in which I'm something like 5/0 LeBlanc/Syndra, I roam both top and bot to help, but my jungler does nothing and we end up losing because of our 0 objectives pressure.

If you're able to play Elise or Lee and gank all 3 lanes after lv3, even if you only give them a 10 cs advantage, you have a good chance to dominate the early game.
And early game is everything right now.

Your title is…absurd. You're tired of the better one winning? Would you rather the trashy ones win?

I'm genuinely confused. Isn't the better player (with all factors included) _always_ going to win a lane, whether the lane is an actual lane, or the jungle?

I think his point is that due to how junglers atm are the same levels as solo laners and have the same gold amount but are never in any risk of dying since they only fight 2v1s or 3v2s. This basically invalidates all the skill from laners, since their lane is decided by junglers and not themselves, which in extension means the better jungler decides the game.

This is especially true in higher elos since the laners usually don't make any major mistakes, so it's completely up to the jungler to get kills for his team. And even if somebody is making a lot of mistakes or the enemy laner is just really good, all the jungler needs to do is camp that lane and disaster averted.
Lmao go read the apdo post on the state of the game from few months ago. Literally he said the best way to win is to cripple the jungler

The "better jungler wins meta" has always been a thing. It's the role with the most influence in the game. The better jungler can take control of the whole map.

> [{quoted}](name=Fed by Snu Snu,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=1fVtK3wr,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-05-06T10:55:14.621+0000)
>
> I&#039;d also love for matchmaking to give me the aggressive jungler for once

There's nothing to comment here. You're just being salty. It's ok. I'd also like matchmaking to give me a bot lane that doesn't lose by the 12 minute mark.


> [{quoted}](name=Fed by Snu Snu,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=1fVtK3wr,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-05-06T10:55:14.621+0000)
>
> these days I have a rift herald knocking on my base at min 15 instead.

Although you are exaggerating, I do get your point and I agree, it definitely needs to be nerfed.

> [{quoted}](name=Fed by Snu Snu,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=1fVtK3wr,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-05-06T10:55:14.621+0000)
>
> Can junglers at least not have the luxury to spend 2 minutes waiting and trying over and over again for a kill?
> 
> I&#039;d also love for matchmaking to give me the aggressive jungler for once, but alas, these days I have a rift herald knocking on my base at min 15 instead.

They will never be punished. Ganking junglers are KING because catchup experience is stupid right now. Ganking junglers will always be the same level as power farmers due to this.

Laners are also responsible for how successful the enemy jungle is though. And their own too, but to a smaller degree.

A mid laner with map presence is also hugely relevant.
I feel like 90% of games are decided in bot lane. I can't believe how stupid bot lane players are. It's not even "who's best?", it's "who is less bad."

I wouldn't even call it "better jungler wins", it's not really even jungling anymore imo. 

The correct decision is always to gank. Forget smite? NP. Just take the buffs, and roam between the lanes applying pressure. 
There is no jungling involved anymore, it's more akin to fucking river shen than actual jungling.

I agree, honestly. Have the camps respawn quicker and give less exp. If junglers want to sit there for 2-3 minutes they should be reasonably punished if the kill doesn't work out. Atm fast clear junglers just wipe their jg and have 2-3 minutes to kill. It's silly and doesn't achieve what they wanted the jungle changes to in the first place.

Players need to learn to be more aggressive.

THE TIME OF PASSIVITY HAS ENDED

PLAY AGGRESSIVE OR LOSE

STOP BANKING ON A 40 MINUTE GAME
So true. People are afraid of winning.
This is one of the most baffling things but it's so true and more people need to realize this.
Or you could play to the strengths of your team

No champion prefers to be passive.

All champions benefit from aggression

im sick of all these junglers({{champion:64}}) being able to keep trying over and over again to gank me with no consequence  besides hoping my junglelr is smart enough to counter jungle (they never are)

I wish it was a "better jungler wins" meta. It is when the teams are even, sure. But I lose tons of games where I'm clearly the better jungler because one of my solo lanes in braindead or one of my bot laners trolls the other. Kill exp is so fucking high that all it takes is a couple free kills fed to the enemy jungler for him to outlevel me despite me having 60 more CS at 15 minutes.
Lol. This has been the meta for 7 seasons :^]

> [{quoted}](name=Blended Fetus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=1fVtK3wr,comment-id=0016,timestamp=2017-05-06T21:30:12.986+0000)
>
> Lol. This has been the meta for 7 seasons :^]

No it wasn't.

Season 3 the jungler didn't have the luxury to camp so hard. They had one chance and they had to make it count, then catch up, then repeat. Lanes actually had breathing space.

And we also had much more reliable warding. Now we have so many blind spots and time that it's all to their advantage.

Later on we had the feral flare and devourer silliness, but still.

Lanes were also not pretty much over with a single kill. Right now a death at level 6 means the lane's pretty much done due to just 1 level disadvantage. And most junglers currently even go as far as to wait until you return to the lane so that they get an easy kill (since you've blown summoners) and you're done. Why? Because they have the luxury to wait, why not just go for the overkill and ensure that you have absolutely 0% chance to come back into even being able to contest creeps from now on.
There's a reason farming junglers have never been meta...
